text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 99 in today's
episode I have a new word for you we not
let's find out what it means and how you
can use it in your daily conversation
way not it is very difficult to break a
habit that you have been following for a
long time our habit can't be broken
immediately or in a day or two it takes
some time for a person to get used to
not having or using something that he
was addicted to the word weaned off
actually means to stop depending on
something you like or something that you
have gotten used to moreover a bad habit
when you slowly and gradually make
someone stop using something that is bad
for them it means you are trying to make
them wean themselves off something for
example if someone is addicted to
drinking alcohol they may find it
difficult to stop consumption all of a
sudden to break free from the habit of
drinking they can slowly wean themselves
off it the word weaned off is a phrasal
verb where wean is a verb and off is a
preposition
there are three forms of this phrasal
verb the past form of wean is weaned off
and the past participle is also wind off
okay now that you know what we know
fiends let's take a look at some example
sentences to see how you can use it in
your daily conversation example one
Josephine weaned her kids off their
obsession of watching cartoons till late
night by tucking them early into bed
example two michelle has gotten so used
to smoking she now finds it very
difficult to wean herself off cigarettes
example three Vicki is on a rigid diet
due to his high cholesterol level he
struggles to wean himself off junk food
that he could liberally eat a few weeks
ago example four despite repeated
attempts Rachael was not successful in
winning her husband off gambling every
night example 5 continuous use of tongs
and hot curlers ruined the quality of
Jennifer's hair she has been asked to
wean herself off them example 6 richard
has to wean himself off the habit of
getting late to work if he wants to
retain his job
example seven James isn't weaning
himself off throwing temper tantrums at
work
he often lands up arguing with his
colleagues example eight being in the
final year of university Walter doesn't
intend to wean himself off his obsession
with playing computer games by using the
time for his studies example nine his
teacher forced Little John to wean
himself off the habit of picking his
nose by keeping an eye on him in the
classroom that's the end of today's
episode have you ever tried weaning
yourself off something
but found it very difficult to do so
kindly share your experiences in the
comment box below this video thank you
for watching us do watch all the
episodes of daily video vocabulary to
better your English language skills do
subscribe to our Channel and stay
updated with all the latest lessons I
will see you again tomorrow with a new
word or a phrase till then bye and take
